definition[0]: a group of sheep, goats, or birds
definition[2]: a priest’s flock is the group of people who regularly attend his or her church
definition[3]: small pieces of wool or cotton that are used for filling cushions
definition[4]: a soft substance that is used to make patterns on the surface of wallpaper, curtains etc
definition[5]: if people flock to a place, they go there in large numbers because something interesting or exciting is happening there
example[2]: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
example[3]: Tourists flock to see the town’s medieval churches and buildings.
